{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3336273,"name":"ThatAlo","username":"ThatAlo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatalo/{size}/214544_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-18T19:40:24.543Z","cooked":"
Issue resolved itself...?

Update

At some point the problem appears to have resolved itself . I’m not sure exactly what the problem is, but all the outputs are within the normal range, and the DS shows no faults. I plan on testing the RIO tomorrow with the navX2 when our shop is open again, but for now all appears good.

My exact reaction right now:

One of our roboRIO 2.0 devices on our comp swerve bot recently stopped communicating with the NavX2 gyro board through MXP. I took the RIO off the bot, and installed our spare, and have been attempting to chase down the source of the fault.

Following all the troubleshooting steps listed in the related post, roborio red power led, I haven’t been able to find or fix the issue. The drive station does show a short on the 5v rail, but I have been unable to find any debris anywhere on the board that would indicate the cause.

Troubleshooting I have completed.
  • Clearing the mainboard with compressed air
  • Turning the RoboRIO upside down and shaking it vigorously.
  • Going over mainboard with an alcohol swab and electronics tweezers and removing all visible debris
  • roboRIO case HAS been opened and internals inspected.
  • Confirmed using another PDH and RIO that the fault lies exclusively inside the RIO.
  • I’ve gone in with a flashlight, and can’t see anything that would cause the short.
  • And, like Diverson from the 2015 post: “A continuity test confirms that the 5V bus is shorted to ground at the DIOs, the analog input, and the SPI connector.” ( tested with multimeter )
  • As per advice from Mark_McLeod, I checked under the black pin header plastic. No debris was present.

I’ve created this post to hold any updates, and also hopefully provide a resource for others. I’ll update this post with any information I get from NI about our RIO. And to the wonderful person receiving the RIOs, ours should have team 1977 on it!

Note:
Both Gerthworm and Akash_Rastogi have commented about issues with the RIO 2, and reccomend sticking with the RIO 1.

Timeline of events ( for my sanity )

March 18th
  • Created CD post
  • Called NI support at +1-800-531-5066 as per the advice in Diverson’s post, but this led nowhere, and I was told to create a forum post.
    → The number, 866-511-6285, in Diverson’s 2015 post is outdated.
  • Created NI forum post: roboRIO 5v short, waiting for a response.
    → My one concern with this is that most of the forum posts I looked at had a response time of multiple days, and we have a comp this Thursday.
  • It’s working ( ? ) now and now I’m confused. I’ll test it tomorrow and confirm

Rio2 seem to absolutely suck in terms of shorting easily. We had ours short with barely any debris inside.

What’s worse is that you are limited one per team per season for purchase.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-03-18T20:18:42.036Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":241,"readers_count":240,"score":53.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459148,"topic_slug":"roborio-5v-short","display_username":"ThatAlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14045,"username":"Domtech","name":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-5v-short/459148/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3336309,"name":"Woolly","username":"Woolly","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/woolly/{size}/6075_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-18T20:19:13.461Z","cooked":"

Have you taken the rio apart? Metal shaving tend to get inside the case easily and cause shorts there. What’s worse is I’ve even seen metal shavings embed themselves into the conformal coating which I fixed on one of ours (a RIO1) by removing the coating with hand sanitizer, rubbing alcohol, and a tooth brush and reapplying fresh conformal coating and then replacing the CAN connector after that got gummed up.

Maybe also give it a good blast of compressed air while you have it apart.

I’ve done that twice before making the post.

Could something possibly be shorting one of the USB ports?

I checked out the USB ports, and see nothing. The short appears to only affect the 5v rail.

image1920×680 190 KB

Adding ports image to root post

I don’t see anything that’s an obvious short that would be causing your problem but that was the case on our rio1, though I do see a decent amount of metal shavings which might be your problem.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-03-18T20:32:24.377Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459148,"topic_slug":"roborio-5v-short","display_username":"Woolly","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56514,"username":"ThatAlo","name":"ThatAlo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatalo/{size}/214544_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18296,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-5v-short/459148/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3336337,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-18T20:40:46.419Z","cooked":"
Akash_Rastogi:

Rio2 seem to absolutely suck in terms of shorting easily.

I know our team only has anecdotal evidence of this. But we’ve fallen back on just reusing our RIO 1.0’s. Zero desire to purchase another 2.0.

We hadn’t broken a RIO in our teams history. Then the 2.0 came out, we broke 3 in 3 years with this exact same failure mode.

Maybe it’s coincidence. But I’m not willing to take that bet.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-03-18T20:40:46.419Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":88.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459148,"topic_slug":"roborio-5v-short","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-5v-short/459148/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3336339,"name":"Mac fraser","username":"Macfraser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/dfb087/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-18T20:41:51.409Z","cooked":"

We have the exact same issue with our Rio2. NavX2 suddenly failed last thursday - I tested the NavX2 independently - via usb, and and on our old RIO1 worked fine. Unfortunately we had an event the following day so we had to go with our old RIO1 for the event. I opened the rio2 blasted it with compressed air, and vacuumed out all the ports still not working. Thank you for pointing to those other resources we just didn’t have time with the event the following day to do any additional debugging and just needed to revert to what we had as a backup. I’ll follow the additional steps you mentioned and see if we get any results.

Debris gets hidden under there a lot.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-03-18T21:16:43.792Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":164,"readers_count":163,"score":37.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459148,"topic_slug":"roborio-5v-short","display_username":"ThatAlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":2123,"username":"Mark_McLeod","name":"Mark McLeod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_mcleod/{size}/65145_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-5v-short/459148/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3336441,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-18T21:45:36.868Z","cooked":"
gerthworm:

But we’ve fallen back on just reusing our RIO 1.0’s. Zero desire to purchase another 2.0.

That’s unfortunate, because WPILib is really struggling to keep things working on the Rio 1.0’s until the new control system lands in 2027. It’s at the point where we will likely need to constrain robot code Java feature development in a few places due to RAM limitations–we’re already falling back on near-heroics (shutting down / replacing system services, etc) to keep things working for teams still using Rio 1.0’s. In general, teams using 2.0’s aren’t having memory issues.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-03-18T21:51:52.769Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":31.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459148,"topic_slug":"roborio-5v-short","display_username":"ThatAlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":2123,"username":"Mark_McLeod","name":"Mark McLeod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_mcleod/{size}/65145_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-5v-short/459148/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3336476,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-18T22:03:37.171Z","cooked":"

I’d rather constrain features than have $500 hardware fail so easily that I can’t easily replace or get spares of.

We were relieved the Rio2 helped with memory issues this year, and now I’m regretting not trying harder to make the rio1.0 work for us.

For next year we plan to use an enclosure we saw 5010 use. @Ryan_Dognaux might as well make it a Thrifty product.

Update:

At some point the problem appears to have resolved itself . I’m not sure exactly what the problem is, but all the outputs are within the normal range, and the DS shows no faults. I plan on testing the RIO tomorrow with the navX2 when our shop is open again, but for now all appears good.

Driver station power tab ( working... )

My exact reaction right now:

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-03-18T22:07:38.845Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459148,"topic_slug":"roborio-5v-short","display_username":"ThatAlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56514,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/roborio-5v-short/459148/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3336506,"name":"","username":"Vasista","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/ccd318/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-18T22:35:29.648Z","cooked":"

I don’t think it’s a big deal. Most Rio 2 teams I see are only plugging in power, can, canivore, rsl, and Ethernet. You can basically shove the entire Rio 2 into a Tupperware container. Or keep the Rio 2 inside the box it came in on the robot.

I don’t really consider “the new one chokes when I shove fistfulls of metal down it’s throat” to be the best bug report.

None of my teams have killed a Rio 2 so far, but I did see one that stopped working until the metal shavings were cleared out from a team at sfr. It had no protection.
